intro: Gouinia paraguayensis var. tortuosa, commonly known as the Paraguay tortuous gouinia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Paraguay and Brazil. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, spirally twisted stems and lance-shaped leaves. It produces showy, yellow flowers with five petals, typically blooming in the spring. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
